occurrences.text: From the top to the bottom. See, remember, as we would look at the shadow of the Old Testament, we think about the tabernacle, and then even into the temple, and you would think about that holy of holies. Yes, there was the outer court that had the brazen altar, and had the laver, but you would come to the holy place, that there you would find that much of the ministry would take place, but then that was separated from the holy of holies that could only be entered on that one day a year, the day of atonement. And you find that that veil that separated the holy place from the holy of holies, that it was rent in twain, showing that now access was available. We'll deal with that as we get into chapters 9 and 10 in more detail, but we understand that when Jesus died on the cross of Calvary, He paid, He was our substitute, and then He rose from the dead. Acts 1 as well as Luke 24 record for us the ascension of Jesus Christ, and the Bible tells us in verse 2 that He is a minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord pitched, and not man. We've read some of these verses already, but you notice as I repeat in Hebrews 4 and verse number 14, the Bible says, seeing then that we have a great high priest that is passed into the heavens.
